greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = position of A112046(n) in A000040.
comment: A112051 gives the first positions of distinct new values in this sequence, that seem also to be the positions of the first occurrence of each n, and thus the positions of the records. Compare also to A084921. - _Antti Karttunen_, May 26 2017
link: Indranil Ghosh (terms 1..1000) & Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..32768
mathematica: a112046[n_]:=Block[{i=1},While[JacobiSymbol[i, 2n + 1]==1, i++]; i];a049084[n_]:=If[PrimeQ[n], PrimePi[n], 0]; Table[a049084[a112046[n]], {n, 102}] (* _Indranil Ghosh_, May 11 2017 *)
program: (PARI) A112049(n) = for(i=1, (2*n), if((kronecker(i, (n+n+1)) < 1), return(primepi(i)))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, May 26 2017
from sympy import jacobi_symbol as J, isprime, primepi
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 103)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 11 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 27 2005
ext: Unnecessary fallback-clause removed from the name by _Antti Karttunen_, May 26 2017
